question: Electromagnetic waves are incident normally on a perfectly reflecting surface having surface area A. If I is the intensity of the incident electromagnetic radiation and c is the speed of light in vacuum, the force exerted by the electromagnetic wave on the reflecting surface is
explanation: The radiation pressure exerted by an electromagnetic wave on a perfectly reflecting surface is <katex>$P = \frac{2I}{c}$</katex>.
The force is Pressure <katex>$\times$</katex> Area: <katex>$F = P \times A = \frac{2IA}{c}$</katex>.
